title: Preparation for Update & A Message on Mods
contents: Title Update 4 will be released soon, as such, we're sharing the following details to help you prepare for the update, including an important message on the use of Mods for the PC version of the game. Release Date and Time Monday 15, 8pm PT / Tuesday 16, 4am GMT Maintenance Period Monday, Dec 15, 3:50pm ‚Äì 8:00pm PT Monday, Dec 15, 11:50pm ‚Äì Tuesday, December 16, 4am GMT During this time, online gameplay will not be available, however you will still be able to play offline. Additionally, after the maintenance is complete, you will need to apply the update to connect online. Required Free Storage Space (For This Update Only) Approximately 12GB maximum (High-Resolution Texture Pack: Approximately +9GB) *Please ensure you have sufficient free storage space. For detailed update information, please check the following page. https://info.monsterhunter.com/wilds/update/en-us/Ver.1.040.00.00.html Once the update has been applied, please confirm that the version displayed on the title screen is 'Ver. 1.040.00.00'. Notification regarding the availability of paid DLC We will simultaneously make several paid DLC items available in this update, but it may take some time for all products to show up on the store. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. For Steam Players To ensure a more stable play environment, we recommend the following graphics driver versions: - NVIDIA GeForce: 581.57 or higher - AMD Radeon: 25.9.1 or higher *Please note that some issues have been confirmed with AMD Radeon versions ‚Äú25.10.2 or higher‚Äù. For driver update instructions, please refer to the following page: https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/2246340/view/534357354429284375 Title Update 4 includes various improvements, primarily CPU/GPU optimizations, involving significant internal processing changes. Our Commitment to Improving Stability and Performance If you have installed unofficial programs, such as Mods, these are not guaranteed to work and could cause compatibility issues, preventing you from launching the game or triggering game crashes. If you encounter problems, please completely uninstall any Mods, recheck the integrity of the game files, and then start the game. Thank you.

title: Our Commitment to Improving Stability and Performance
contents: To all players of Monster Hunter Wilds,Title update 4 will be released on December 16, 2025. This update will deliver additional content, including Gogmazios, the first Elder Dragon in Wilds, and the expansion of endgame content with the addition of the Gogma Artian Weapons.In this update we also focus on improving the game's stability and performance, implementing various improvements including CPU/GPU optimization for all platforms.*Content in development is subject to change. To further improve stability and performance, additional improvements will be implemented in a patch exclusive to the Steam version in late January 2026, as well as in the Ver. 1.041 update in February.We would like to take this opportunity to express our sincere gratitude to everyone who has reported issues and provided feedback.Your feedback has aided the development team's ongoing work to improve the overall experience through these updates. We'd like to further explain the stability and performance improvements roadmap that was shown in the December 2025 Monster Hunter Showcase.Free Title Update 4 (Available December 16, 2025)Free Title Update 4 will implement CPU/GPU optimisations across all platforms: PlayStation¬Æ5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steam.Processing Improvements and Load ReductionProcessing time will be improved by distributing the process across frames for elements that demand the heaviest load, which includes players, monsters, and graphical user interfaces (primarily the HUD and maps).Processing load is reduced by comprehensively reviewing and streamlining various processes, such as reducing the number of simultaneous effects and improving collision detection for Palico and Seikret.Various other improvements, including optimization and reduction of memory usage, will be implemented.These measures are designed to improve the experience for all players, while avoiding negatively impacting the existing game. By implementing improvements to common processes experienced by all players, we aim to resolve issues experienced by players on a wide variety of hardware configurations. Gameplay Comparisons - TU3 vs. TU4 (Steam Version)Here's a look at gameplay comparison videos showing the differences between Free Title Update 3 and Free Title Update 4 on the 'Recommended specs' of the 'Steam version system requirements'.*Testing was conducted with the frame generation setting set to "Disable".*Performance metrics captured using Steam's in-game overlay performance monitor. *This is only one example, and performance may vary depending on PC configuration and other environmental factors.*Content in development is subject to change. 1. Intel CPU and NVIDIA GPU combinationThis video tests the exact CPU and GPU combination specified in our recommended specs in system requirements.Hardware EnvironmentCPU: Intel Core i5-10400GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 Super (VRAM 8GB)Resolution: 1080p (Upscaled) *NVIDIA DLSS: PerformanceGraphics Settings: Medium2.AMD CPU and AMD GPU combinationThis video tests the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X CPU, which is the most commonly used CPU within the recommended range based on the system requirements.*The AMD CPU specified in the recommended specs in system requirements is the AMD Ryzen 5 3600.Hardware EnvironmentCPU: AMD Ryzen 5 5600XGPU: AMD Radeon RX 6600ÔºàVRAM 8GBÔºâResolution: 1080p (Upscaled) *AMD FSR: PerformanceGraphics Settings: MediumCurrently, in the Windward Plains locale, which is prone to heavy load during Inclemency events, the frame rate hovers around 40 FPS for both environment settings (1) and (2) when the frame generation option is set to "Disable". However, we confirmed that in most cases FPS goes higher than 40 FPS after applying the update.We also confirmed a frame rate improvement of roughly 5% or more in the Scarlet Forest and Oilwell Basin. While in these areas, players will generally experience higher average frame rates than in the Windward Plains. *This is only one example, and performance may vary depending on PC configuration and other environmental factors. For instance, this update yields limited improvements for hardware at the "minimum" system requirements, when compared to the improved frame rate seen at the "recommended" system requirements. Following the release of Free Title Update 4, we will continue to deliver stability and performance improvements. Next, we'll share further details on the updates planned for January and February 2026. NoticeFollowing the release of Free Title Update 4, we plan to remove the Monster Hunter Wilds Benchmark from Steam. With the improved performance of the retail version introduced in Free Title Update 4, the benchmark no longer provides an accurate result for players. Steam Version Exclusive Patch (Late January 2026)This patch will include optimization improvements for Steam-specific processes and options to reduce processing load. It will also include a review of presets.Addition of Settings to Reduce CPU LoadA "CPU" tab will be added to the Options men...

title: Rey Dau Masterclass & Concept Art!
contents: Hey hunters,How‚Äôs the hunting?Today we‚Äôd like to share with you some behind the scenes concept art from the development of Monster Hunter Wilds, ahead of Free Title Update 4‚Äôs release on December 16!We‚Äôll kick things off with a recap of the Rey Dau Masterclass presentation that Monster Hunter Wilds director, Yuya Tokuda, conducted recently at the 'Monster Hunter Festa 2025 Paris' event, after which we‚Äôll take a look at the creation process behind Arkveld and the Wudwuds!Rey Dau Masterclass Recap*Please note, the information in the images shown in this section are from development and may differ from the final product.Rey Dau rules the Windward Plains as its apex predator. Let‚Äôs take a look at each part of Rey Dau. Its head and mouth have the distinctive shape of a predator with sharp teeth designed to tear through herbivorous monsters. The structure of the operational fangs and jaws draws inspiration from the mandibles of centipedes.When Rey Dau becomes fully charged, it closes the discharge organ in its head and unleashes a powerful electric discharge attack.To withstand the force of such a powerful strike, Rey Dau exposes the charging organ from its neck and stabilises its head, then by conducting the electricity from its tail, through to its neck, it can release all the electricity stored throughout its body in one go!Rey Dau has electricity-generating organs in its body that cause it to become charged and generate electrothermal energy during attacks by dragging its charged wings and tail along the sand. The sand then crystallises and attaches to Rey Dau‚Äôs body. These non-conductive, glass-like crystals helps suppress and control electrical discharges from the monster‚Äôs internal electricity-generating organs, aiding it in unleashing powerful electric attacks.The highly textured surface of Rey Dau‚Äôs body also has the effect of drawing electricity from the charged atmosphere in a sandstorm, enabling it to become charged at an accelerated rate during Inclemency.If Rey Dau moves while covered in crystals, the pieces of ore rub against each other and emit sounds. The people of Kunafa Village gather this ore, craft noise-making items, and use them to ward off monsters.Ores are used not only for the noise-making items but also for home decorations.The decoration on the chieftain's house on the far right resembles the pattern which displays the power of the thunder attribute.This diagram depicts the symbol of the Ruins of Wyveria appearing within the game. The pattern in the top left corner represents the power of the lightning attribute. That wraps up the masterclass, but we‚Äôve got even more concept art waiting for you below!Arkveld Here's a look into the creation of a flagship monster, Arkveld, and its piercing gaze!What are your most memorable moments from clashing with The White Wraith? Feel free to let us know in the comments.WudwudTo explain this piece of concept art, we felt it best to ask the cheeky denizens of the Scarlet Forest themselves: ‚ÄúPlease be perceptious of Wudwud wearing fur of pink menace! Pay tribooty! Happy Time! Share!‚ÄùThat wraps up today‚Äôs post, thanks for taking the time to check it out! We‚Äôll have more concept art to share with you in the future too!Thank you all for your continued feedback, support and passion.We‚Äôll see you in the hunt!- The Monster Hunter Community Team

title: Regarding your Video/Graphics Drivers
contents: We have confirmed game crashes and other forced shutdowns affecting users, caused by issues with graphics cards in their systems. To ensure stable performance, please update (download and install) to the latest drivers. The following driver versions are recommended:‚Äì NVIDIA GeForce Series: 581.57 or later‚Äì AMD Radeon Series: 25.9.1 or 25.9.2Note: Some issues have been identified with AMD Radeon drivers versions 25.10.2 and higher.Note: This information is subject to change without notice due to circumstances such as the end of support from NVIDIA or AMD. Updating GeForce (NVIDIA) Drivers Updating via the NVIDIA App (Recommended for Beginners)NVIDIA offers a convenient tool called the NVIDIA App that automatically scans your system and recommends the optimal drivers. You can use this software to easily install the latest drivers for your GPU. Go to the NVIDIA App website below and click the "Download Now" link to download and install the application. https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/software/nvidia-app/ Instructions Once the NVIDIA App installation is complete, open the application and click the Drivers tab. The drivers page will open and the latest driver will be downloaded. Once the download is complete, click on the "INSTALL" button. You'll be asked for permission to install the driver. Select "Yes" to continue the installation. Select "Custom installation". Check the box for "Clean installation" and continue the installation. (For a clean graphics driver installation, we recommend using the clean installation option.) The uninstallation of old drivers and the installation of new drivers will begin automatically. Once the installation is complete, make sure any game clients are fully closed and restart your computer. Driver updates are now complete. Updating Drivers ManuallyOpen the link to the NVIDIA graphics driver site below. https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/ Instructions In the Manual Driver Search section, enter your product or select the options that match your graphics card and click "Find". You'll be taken to the search results page and a list of drivers. Click "View" on the driver you want to install. For optimal stability on Windows, choose the "WHQL" version which has Microsoft's WHQL certification. Click "Download". Updating Radeon (AMD) Drivers Updating via AMD Software: Adrenalin Edition (Recommended for Beginners)AMD offers a convenient tool called AMD Software: Adrenalin Edition that automatically scans your system and recommends the optimal drivers. You can use this software to easily install the latest drivers for your GPU. Go to the AMD Software: Adrenalin Edition website below and click the "Download Software" link to download and install the application. https://www.amd.com/en/products/software/adrenalin.html Instructions Once the installation of AMD Software: Adrenalin Edition is complete, open the application. The drivers will be automatically detected. The installation screen will appear. Select "Additional Options". Check the box for "Factory Reset (Optional)". (For a clean graphics driver installation, we recommend using the factory reset option.) Click the "Install" button in the bottom right corner of the window. The uninstallation of old drivers and the installation of new drivers will begin automatically. Once the installation is complete, make sure any game clients are fully closed and restart your computer. Driver updates are now complete. Updating Drivers ManuallyOpen the link to the AMD Graphics Driver site below. https://www.amd.com/en/support/download/drivers.html Instructions Select the browsing options to find your product and graphics card information and click "Submit". Alternatively, enter your AMD product name and click "Search". You'll be taken to a page that lists Radeon drivers. Select your Windows version. For optimal stability on Windows, choose the "WHQL Recommended" version which has Microsoft's WHQL certification. Download the desired driver. What to Do When Driver Installation Fails If driver installation fails, there may be several factors contributing to the issue. First, your antivirus software or other security software may be interfering with the installation. Try disabling this software before installing the driver, and enabling it again afterwards. Existing drivers or software may also be interfering. Try uninstalling old drivers before attempting to reinstall the latest version. If the problem persists, we recommend trying a clean installation of your graphics card driver. Leftover driver DLL files or game profiles in your system could be causing problems, so a clean install will eliminate these. Many users opt for a third-party program called Display Driver Uninstaller (DDU) to perform a clean installation of their graphics board drivers, which completely removes components that were part of the original driver installation package. title: [Important] End of Support Notice for Windows 10
contents: Thank you to all our fans for enjoying Capcom products. Microsoft will be ending support for Windows 10 on October 14, 2025. Therefore, as of the same date, we will no longer guarantee that Monster Hunter: World, Monster Hunter Rise and Monster Hunter Wilds will run on Windows 10 systems. Proper game functionality cannot be guaranteed on operating systems of which Microsoft has ended support. If an issue running the game occurs, support can only be provided based on information from before support for Windows 10 was discontinued. title: Guild Reports - Community Information Hub & Recent Posts!
contents: Hey hunters, How's it going? We hope you're enjoying the 9‚≠ê monsters and getting yourself some juicy Talismans for your sets!We also hope you're looking forward to the Monster Hunter Wilds x FINAL FANTASY XIV Collaboration and the arrival of Omega Planetes, coming with Free Title Update 3 later this month!Now, onto today's post, Guild Reports! Guild Report WebsiteBack in June of this year, we introduced "Guild Reports", a new way for us to give you insight on some of the work the Dev Team are working on and have done, based on community feedback.Since then we've released 31 Guild Reports on our Monster Hunter Twitter / X account, covering areas including new content, weapon balance changes, quality of life changes, bug fixes, game stability and more.Now as we post these fairly often, we haven't been posting them here to Steam to avoid spamming your notifications, instead giving broader, periodic updates with our Director's Letters from Monster Hunter Wilds director, Yuya Tokuda.But, there's a lot of pretty cool and recent info in these Guild Reports, so we wanted to let you all know that you can find every Guild Report we've released so far on a dedicated webpage on our official site, check it out by clicking the button below:Guild Report Hub We'll share some recent posts below to give you a couple of examples of what you can expect!Recent Guild ReportsGuild Report 31 - 19th September - New 9‚òÖ tempered monsters in TU3 As part of our continued improvement efforts, we are introducing the additional tempered monsters (9‚òÖ) included in Title Update 3 (scheduled for release at the end of September 2025).Adjustment:9‚òÖ tempered versions of Blangonga, Guardian Fulgur Anjanath, and Ajarakan will be added as alternating Event Quests! Rewards include items like Glowing Stones, Heavy Armor Spheres, and Oricalcite.Facing the 9‚òÖ tempered versions of these monsters will offer a whole new level of challenge. Take them on if you dare! Plus, don't miss out on the various other Event Quests and seasonal events.Guild Report 27 - 8th September - Support Hunter Buffs & New Support Hunter in TU3 As part of our continued improvement efforts, we'd like to share the following Support Hunter adjustments coming in Title Update 3 (scheduled for release at the end of September 2025).Adjustments: Increasing the base attack and defense of Support Hunters. Additionally, when accompanying you on high-difficulty quests (8‚òÖ and 9‚òÖ), they'll receive an additional boost.Adding new Support Hunter, "Kai," who specializes in the Hunting Horn (Doot!).These updates will make your Support Hunters even more dependable allies. Be sure to take them with you on your next hunt!Guild Report 24 - 22nd August - Lagiacrus in Wounded Hollow, Monster pack hunts & more!We'd like to introduce four highlights from the quality-of-life improvements planned for Title Update 3 at the end of September. We hope that these changes add more variety and replayability to your hunts.1. Lagiacrus will now appear in the Wounded HollowLagiacrus can now appear in this locale, and its behavior has been tuned around the unique characteristics of the location. There is also a rare chance for Lagiacrus to appear with other monsters that are not found in the Scarlet Forest.2. Quests can now have monster packs as quest targetsQuests featuring monster packs as targets can now appear, with guaranteed rewards for Heavy Armor Spheres. Herding monsters that apply are: Doshaguma; Hirabami; Yian Kut-Ku.3. Mantle cooldownsMantle cooldowns will now reset at the start of a quest.4. Pop-up camp destructionMonsters will no longer actively seek out pop-up camps to attack.The team is committed to listening to your feedback and making further improvements to Monster Hunter Wilds. Thank you for your support! That wraps up our examples, as well as this post, so thank you for taking the time to check it out! As a reminder, you can check out all current and future Guild Reports on their dedicated, official web page HERE, as well as catching them super fresh when they drop on the official Monster Hunter Twitter / X account. Thank you all for your continued feedback, support and passion.We‚Äôll see you in the hunt!- The Monster Hunter Community Team

title: Director's Letter - A Message from Director Tokuda (August 2025)
contents: Hello hunters! This is Yuya Tokuda, the director of Monster Hunter Wilds. Thank you so much for playing Monster Hunter Wilds. And a big thank you as well to all the hunters who have been sharing their game feedback and requests.The entire development team is carefully reviewing your feedback and working hard to implement improvements and adjustments.We apologize for the time some improvements may take, but we are committed to delivering a more enjoyable and satisfying gaming experience, so we greatly appreciate your patience.As previously announced, we plan to release the Ver. 1.021 Update on Wednesday, August 13.This update will include expanded end-game content, balance adjustments for weapons, and other adjustments and improvements.Expanded End-game ContentOriginally planned for implementation in the third title update scheduled for the end of September, we've moved up the implementation of expanded end-game content to the Ver. 1.021 update.We will be adding a new set of high-difficulty quests, and as rewards for completing them, you can obtain talismans with randomly assigned bonuses, including weapon skills.1. As a new set of high-difficulty quests, 9‚òÖ monsters will start appearing when you are HR 100 or higher.Starting with Ver. 1.021, Tempered Monsters (9‚òÖ) of nine monster species will begin appearing in locales.Following that, our third title update in late September will see additional 9‚òÖ monsters appear in event quests. For veteran players who have experienced end-game content in previous Monster Hunter titles, we understand that the difficulty of Tempered Monsters at launch may have felt lacking. Therefore, starting with Title Update 2, we've introduced a system for more detailed monster parameter customization, as well as other adjustments to ensure a challenging and rewarding experience.2. We're adding the Glowing Stone appraisal item as a quest reward for quests with 9‚òÖ monsters.Upon quest completion, the Glowing Stone appraisal item‚Äîa quest reward for quests with 9‚òÖ monsters‚Äîwill transform into an Appraised Talisman with randomly assigned skills.Unlike other talismans which can be crafted and upgraded at the Smithy, Appraised Talismans cannot be upgraded. However, they can be randomly granted not only armor skills but weapon skills and decoration slots (both weapon skill and armor skill decoration slots), allowing for more customization and experimentation with builds. We hope this leads to more engaging gameplay and encourages hunters to try different weapons and armor based on the talismans they obtain.Additionally, we recognized that end-game content early after the game's release was slightly skewed around Arkveld. This, combined with the fact that Arkveld is relatively resistant to elements, resulted in limited opportunities to try out diverse builds. In response, we have adjusted the difficulty, average hunting time, and rewards for each of the 9‚òÖ monsters being added in an effort to ensure that all monsters offer balanced rewards fitting with the effort spent hunting them. We encourage you to select your hunts based on your own individual skill, equipment, or needs, and enjoy each challenge.9‚òÖ Monster AdjustmentsIn light of the addition of 9‚òÖ monsters, we've lengthened the duration of meal effects so that they're less likely to expire if the hunts go on a little long. We also raised the upgrade limit for armor of rarity 5 or above, so that players can squeeze in a little more defense before they go up against these challenging new monsters.Additionally, from HR 100 and higher, Rey Dau and Nu Udra will now appear in the Wounded Hollow, and each region's apex predator will be more likely to appear even with that region is not experiencing an inclemency.Title Update 3As mentioned previously, Title Update 3 will see the gradual introduction of 9‚òÖ monsters in Event Quests as well. We are also adjusting the strength of support hunters in line with the addition of 9‚òÖ monsters. We apologize that the timing of these adjustments are in stages and come after the implementation of the monsters themselves, but we hope you understand that this is a result of expediting the monster implementation.In order to diversify the lineup of quests, we are working to make it possible for Lagiacrus to appear in the Wounded Hollow, as well as other additions such as more hunts targeting packs of monsters. We are also implementing adjustments to improve gameplay convenience, such as preventing monsters from spontaneously destroying pop-up camps and resetting the cooldown for mantles upon beginning a quest.Finally, we can also assure you that any new monsters added in Title Update 3 will also feature 9‚òÖ difficulty quests. We hope you look forward to the new contents for Title Update 3, and that in the meantime you can enjoy the new additions from Ver. 1.021 to strengthen your equipment and collect Appraised Talismans in preparation for the challenging hunts ahead.Weapon Balance ChangesAs previously announced, we h...

title: New Endgame Content Coming August 13!
contents: Hey hunters, How's the hunting?Today we've got some exciting news to share with you on new endgame content that's now arriving ahead of schedule in August, including a new quest difficulty, and a new reward system to delve into!Before we get into that though, we just wanted to signpost that today's post mostly focuses on new endgame content, as well as hightlighting upcoming weapon balance and the extension of the Flamefete event! We're aware of the community's request for more information on our work towards further optimisation / game stability and we'll have more to share on that in the future, but today's post is focused on game content. Right then, let's take a look at what's coming in August!An update on release date and content of update Ver.1.021The expansion of endgame content which was originally planned as part of Title Update 3 in late September will now be released ahead of schedule as part of the Ver.1.021 update. To accommodate this change, this update will be moving slightly out of its planned early August window to the date below:Ver.1.021: Wednesday, 13 August 2025The main content of this update is as follows (more details will be released in the near future).üí™ New level of quest difficultyüèÖ New rewards system for the above quests featuring Talismans with random skill combinationsüõ†Ô∏è Weapon balance adjustments (will cover more weapons than originally planned)‚öôÔ∏è Other improvements and adjustmentsThank you for your patience whilst we prepare this update, we're looking forward to you enjoying this new content soon!Festival of Accord: Flamefete ExtensionWith Ver.1.021 now coming on 13 August, we're extending the Flamefete event for an extra week! This means you've got extra time to unlock new gear such as themed event armour sets, Cornpopper Gunlance as well as play a wide range of Event Quests with unique rewards, all in a very summary Grand Hub whilst being serenaded by the Diva, who's even added a new song to her repertoire!Plus, by logging in and claiming your login bonus during Flamefete, you'll unlock a bunch of free cosmetics, including the Water Gun emote, a new decoration for your Seikret, as well as camp items and more!Make a splash in the Grand Hub and the hunt!The Firebird Caparison is free and yours to keep if claimed during Flamefete and can be found in the Seikret Customization menu. Yes, you can change the colour of the flames too!Quest Complete ‚Äì We‚Äôll see you next time!That wraps up today‚Äôs post, thanks for taking the time to check it out!As mentioned, we'll be sharing further details on all the new content and adjustments coming in Ver.1.021 in the near future, so watch this space!We‚Äôll see you in the Wilds!- The Monster Hunter Community Team

title: Welcome to the Wilds!
contents: Hey hunters, Free Title Update 2 is here, bringing with it a host of new content for you to enjoy, including the return of the legendary leviathan, Lagiacrus and the Thousand Blade Wyvern, Seregios, as well as the addition of layered weapons and more!Plus, if you‚Äôre reading this before 10th July, Monster Hunter Wilds is currently 20% off here on Steam with its first discount on the platform! So, if you‚Äôre looking to try your first ever Monster Hunter title, or make the jump from World or Rise, we‚Äôd like to say, welcome to the Wilds!The Hunt So Far!Time has flown by since Monster Hunter Wilds launched on the 28th February, heralding a new generation of Monster Hunter, including many series firsts, such as a seamless hunting experience, locales that can change in an instant, Focus Mode and cross-platform play!In true Monster Hunter tradition, we‚Äôve also been supporting the game post-launch with free new content, from monsters, weapons, armour, Palico gear, Event Quests, our first seasonal festival, a Capcom collab and the arrival of the Grand Hub, our largest Monster Hunter social space to date!We‚Äôve also been putting out patches to address balance, bug fixes and performance, which we‚Äôll touch on more a little later in the ‚ÄúDirector‚Äôs Letter‚Äù section!To visualise what‚Äôs been added so far, and will soon become available throughout Free Title Update 2, we‚Äôve put together a little infographic for you:We managed to squeeze just a few of our Event Quests and their rewards into the infographic, and we‚Äôve got even more on the way for you! There‚Äôs also an Event Quest schedule that you can check out here, detailing what‚Äôs coming over the next three weeks, from the quests themselves to their special rewards!Title Update 2 RoadmapWe‚Äôve also got a breakdown of Title Update 2‚Äôs content and when it‚Äôs available below!And yes, we‚Äôre pleased to share with you that Free Title Update 3 is confirmed for late September!Hunting Solo or With Others!If you‚Äôre new to Monster Hunter Wilds, or Monster Hunter as a whole, you‚Äôll be pleased to know that you can play through the vast majority of game‚Äôs story, as well as nearly all quests in either solo or multiplayer, which you can change at pretty much any moment as you play!Solo HuntingIf you prefer a more solo experience, you can with just you and your Palico or even use NPC Support Hunters to give you the multiplayer experience without needing to play with other humans or be online.You can bring them into a hunt by using your SOS flare, and adjust their behaviours and actions in your Start Menu settings for a bespoke experience! What‚Äôs more, if they faint, it won‚Äôt count toward a quest‚Äôs fail state nor reduce reward money, so they‚Äôre ideal for helping on tough quests, or just for a bit of company when playing solo!Multiplayer HuntsThere‚Äôs also a range of ways for you to team-up and hunt alongside friends and other players in Wilds! (Even more so with cross-platform play woo!)To highlight the features available to you, we put together a short one and a half minute video to give you a quick overview:In a nutshell, there‚Äôs a few ways to enjoy multiplayer in Wilds:Lobby: Jump into the same lobby together, then post and join each other‚Äôs quests.Link Party: This can be used in the same lobby, or even when you‚Äôre in different ones! Simply send a Link Party request to a hunter (or hunters) on your friend list and whenever one of you starts a quest, everyone else receives an invite to the quest. After quest completion, you‚Äôre returned to your lobby.Environment Link: A group that locks the locale‚Äôs environment to that of the host, allowing you to continually explore and hunt in a specific locale under a preferred season.SOS Flares: A great way to jump into specific hunts with the wider player base! Whether searching for them at camp / the Grand Hub or firing one off yourself mid-hunt to request backup!In addition, as part of Title Update 2 we‚Äôve added some new quality of life features for the Steam version to help you group up with your hunting party even swifter:You can now copy the Lobby ID/Hunter ID via the Start Menu.You can now copy the Squad ID via the Squad Menu.Fun fact, NPC Support Hunters can also be used alongside other players, as long as your party doesn‚Äôt exceed four of you! So, you can have two players and two Support Hunters, for example, or just turn off Support Hunters and play alongside your preferred party size of players ‚Äì the choice is yours!The Grand HubThe Grand Hub, the largest social space in a Monster Hunter title to date, both in area and the number of hunters that can be present arrived as part of Free Title Update 1!This location is unlocked upon completion of the game‚Äôs story up to at least Chapter 3 and reaching HR16, after which you‚Äôll be able to talk to Tetsuzan in a ‚Äúlate game location‚Äù (no spoilers!), granting you access and opening a new fast travel option on your map!As well as being a great place to socialise with other hunters, there‚Äôs plenty to do and enj...

title: Update Summary (Ver.1.020)
contents: You must install the latest version of Monster Hunter Wilds in order to play online multiplayer and access downloadable content. Required Space Approx. 6 GB (With High Resolution Texture Pack: Approx. 19 GB total) Note: Make sure to have enough additional storage to allow for slight differences in final size. Major Additions and Changes Monsters Lagiacrus has been added and is available in an extra mission. To unlock the extra mission, you must be at least HR 31 and have had completed both the main mission "A World Turned Upside Down" and the side mission "Forest Doshaguma." Tempered Lagiacrus has been added and will appear when you are HR 41+ after completing the Lagiacrus extra mission. Seregios has been added and is available in an extra mission. Tempered Seregios has been added and will appear when you are HR 41+ after completing the Seregios extra mission. Arch-tempered Uth Duna has been added. Added new Support Hunters‚ÄîMina (Sword & Shield) and Fabius (Lance)‚Äîwhich will become available to join quests after completing the main mission "A Hunter's Pride." The Change Lobby Menu can now be accessed at your tent in base camps or Pop-up Camps. You can now choose to switch your handler from Alma to Erik, or vice versa. This feature is unlocked after completing the Lagiacrus mission. A function has been added to the Provisions Stockpile that allows you to trade for seasonal event items. A new Festival of Accord event will be held from July 23 to August 6, 2025. The following features will be temporarily modified during the Festival of Accord: the Handler's Outfit; Seikret decoration; the Diva's song list; the Grand Hub decorations; the Canteen menu; Barrel Bowling; Large Barrel Bombs. Barrel Bowling Bombs during seasonal events also behave differently than normal Large Barrel Bombs, making for a unique challenge. (This area becomes available at a certain point in the extra mission Trembling Blue Currents.) A new key dialogue has been added for Ferdinand in the Windward Plains Base Camp. Speak with him and complete the conditions to get a new pendant. The Environment Overview can now be checked in the Grand Hub, and includes notifications on when events are currently being held, such as the Festival of Accord. title: Mini Director's Letter - July 2025 & Introducing Guild Reports!
contents: Hey hunters, We hope you enjoyed the Free Title Update 2 news we've just revealed as part of the Capcom Spotlight!And now, we've got even more for you, including a Mini Director's Letter, as well as the introduction of a new way for us to communicate and give updates to you all on what we're working on, based on community feedback, Guild Reports! So, let's get straight to it and hand over to Director Tokuda as he's got plenty to share with you, including upcoming content, performance and stability plans, weapon balancing and more!Mini Director's Letter - July 2025 Hello, hunters! This is Yuya Tokuda, director of Monster Hunter Wilds. Thank you to everyone who watched the Capcom Spotlight for news on Free Title Update 2. Free Title Update 2 - Major AdditionsThe second Free Title Update will feature two additional monsters, Lagiacrus and Seregios, as well as additional features such as Layered Weapons, and later in the summer, the release of Arch-Tempered Uth Duna.Everyone on the development team worked hard on Lagiacrus and Seregios to make them as enjoyable as possible. We hope you will enjoy seeing them in Free Title Update 2 when they are released.In this Director's Letter, I would like to introduce some of the details that we were not able to share with you in the Capcom Spotlight program. This includes improvements and adustments featured in Free Title Update 2, as well as further updates still to come. Free Title Update 2: Major Improvements and AdjustmentsThank you very much for sending us your feedback and requests via the survey form. In particular, we would like to thank you for your feedback on in four key areas: (1) Usability (UI/UX) Improvements, (2) Weapons Balance Adjustments, (3) Improved Game Stability (Steam version), and (4) More challenging hunts & further gear to chase. We are aware of these core feedback areas and are working to improve and adjust them. In Free Title Update 2, the main improvements and adjustments to (1) to (3) are planned to include the contents of the attached image. Please note that only includes a small amount of the improvements coming in Free Title Update 2. For more details and other details, please visit the website to read the full update notes.We will continue to make improvements to (1) to (3) in future updates. Next, I'd like to focus on how we plan to introduce more challenging hunts, as well as more late and endgame gear pursuits to the game in future updates. Future Update PlansSo far, we have discussed what we will be addressing in the second Free Title Update, however we feel there are still many points of feedback and requests to address. In particular, expanding endgame content is a focus area for us in future updates. Here's a look at how we plan to expand the endgame content. Free Title Update 3 (end of September) In Free Title Update 3, a new level of quest difficulty will be added, which will feature their own unique rewards. Hunters can use these rewards for a new Talisman crafting system, which can be assigned various skills at random. The new Talismans can be assigned a wide variety of skills, including those exclusive to Weapons and Armor, and will also be randomly assigned slots for decorations as well. We believe this system will broaded the range of builds, and create a gameplay loop that encourages players to equip themselves to take on the game's toughest challenges. We will announce information on the main features of Free Title Update 3 separately at a later date, so please look out for more information in the future!Free Title Update 4 (this winter)Free Title Update 4 is scheduled to be released this winter.This update will include a new monster as well as more challenging elements.We are considering ways to ensure that the Artian weapons you have already forged will remain valuable, so we hope you will continue to forge and strengthen your Artian weapons while waiting for more info on Free Title Update 4 in the future. We are also working on various improvements and adjustments, including improving usability and game stability. We will continue to work on through these updates. Title Updates, excluding bug fixes and other updates, will be implemented every few months, as with the first and second updates. Thanks for your patience!Guild ReportsTo keep you updated on what the development team is working on going forward, we plan to share a series of "Guild Reports" on this account. Through these reports, we'll share our response to your feedback and requests, and how we plan to address them going forward. We'll share the specific details of our responses, including those that are not covered in the Director's Letter, through our social media channels. Thank you to everyone who has played Monster Hunter Wilds and shared their feedback and requests. We take community feedback seriously and will continue to do our utmost to provide a more comfortable and enjoyable gaming experience. We hope you will continue to enjoy Monster Hunter Wilds.-...

title: A Message from Director Tokuda (May 2025)
contents: Hello hunters! This is Yuya Tokuda, the director of Monster Hunter Wilds. I would like to express my deepest gratitude to everyone who has played our game. As previously announced, the Ver. 1.011 update is planned to release on May 28, bringing an abundance of new features and changes to the game including a collaboration with Street Fighter 6. With Ver. 1.011, Title Update 2 and subsequent title updates, we want to provide more great content for you to enjoy as well as make various adjustments to make Monster Hunter Wilds even more fun to play. I hope you'll check out each update as it's released. Street Fighter 6 Special Collaboration This special collaboration features equipment that will prepare you for any fight from the wilds to the streets, as well as a new challenger to the game: Akuma! {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/44795648/bb5ef3fe3dba66628f206d3fb461c14564c5db51.jpg Included in the collaboration equipment are the Akuma full armor set and Akuma layered armor. When you have either equipped, three items will be added to the Item Bar - Assisted Combo: Akuma, Drive Impact, and Gou Hadoken. Note: The full armor set grants extra bonuses to these Akuma attacks! Now I'd like to go into a little more detail about Assisted Combo: Akuma and Drive Impact. Assisted Combo: Akuma This attack can be selected from the Item Bar consecutively to pull off a combo. When performing a combo, you can press or to activate different moves! Drive Impact Your Drive Gauge fills over time, and once it's full, a Drive Impact can be performed. Drive Impacts can be activated by selecting the move in the Item Bar, or by holding then pressing during a combo. When Akuma's full armor set is equipped, this move will gain an offset effect, and hitting a monster's wound or weak point will activate the Shun Goku Satsu attack that will gain stun properties. Used skilfully, these actions can be used to slay even the more difficult monsters in the game!
